explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of Least Squares Support Vector Machine (LS-SVM) for credit scoring, which is a machine learning technique.
explanations.supervised learning: Credit scoring involves classifying customers into risk groups based on labeled data, which is a supervised learning task.
explanations.classification: The paper explicitly mentions that credit scoring is an application of classification techniques to categorize customers into different risk groups.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper focuses on using Least Squares Support Vector Machine (LS-SVM), a variant of SVM, for credit scoring.
explanations.SVM: The paper discusses Least Squares Support Vector Machine (LS-SVM), which is a re-formulation of the standard SVM.
